bibl.title: Letter from Frances Wood to Philip Showalter Hench, September 11, 1940

div1.p: Wood sends Hench a newspaper article concerning William H. Dean and tells him about the Dean Memorial Bridge.

div1.head: Letter from Frances Wood to Philip Showalter Hench, September 11, 1940
div1.opener:
SAMUEL H. RANCK, Librarian
Chiefs of Departments
ELIZABETH STEINMANN, Reference
ANNIE A. POLLAND, Personnel and Training
SADIE P. WYKES, Catalogue
ADAN C. CANFIELD, Circulation
MAY G. QUIOLEY, Children
MRS. FLORENCE L. BORN, Branch
MRS. GEORGIA S. LAWTON, Order
LUELLA N. JESSUP, Office Administration
THE GRAND RAPIDS PUBLIC LIBRARY
Over 485,000 Books and Pamphlets
Over 1,200 Current Periodicals
Main (Ryerson) Library and 35 Branches
and Stations
RYERSON LIBRARY BUILDING
GRAND RAPIDS, MICHIGAN
September 11, 1940
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Your letter concerning William H. Dean was turned over
to our department, the Michigan Room. In searching through our
files, we found a duplicate copy of a newspaper article which we
are mailing you. The second part was incomplete, but was typed
for you from our complete copy. You need not return the article.

We feel sure that all the information that you need will
be found in the article. If If you need more, please let us know,
as we have more material concerning him.

The Dean Memorial bridge is one of the three main bridges
crossing the Grand River in Grand Rapids. It is on West Fulton
Street, one of the two dividing lines of this city.

I searched the post card racks of most of the down town
stores yesterday, but was unable to find a copy of the bridge. The
Camera Shop may have a photograph which they would sell for fifty
cents.
